column1: #Text=The studied Bi2Se3 crystals have been prepared using the standard Bridgman method.
#Text=The starting material for growing the single crystals was prepared from the elements Bi and Se of 5 N purity.
#Text=Polycrystalline material was prepared from a mixture of the elements close to stoichiometry (Bi:Se = 2:3) in silica ampoules evacuated to a pressure of 10−4 Pa.
#Text=The synthesis was carried out at the temperature of 1073 K.
#Text=A conical quartz ampoule, containing the synthesized polycrystalline material, was then placed in the upper (warmer) part of the Bridgman furnace, where it was remelted.
#Text=Then it was lowered into a temperature gradient of 80 K/cm (30 K/cm for the sample C) at a rate of 1.3 mm/h.
#Text=Three bulk crystals, differing in the concentration of conduction-band electrons in the conduction band, have been chosen for this study.
#Text=They were characterized by approximate electron densities , and  cm−3 and denoted as samples A, B and C, respectively.
